comments:

Based on the stack trace, it looks like the Workbench is closing everything down as soon as it comes up.  Do you have any idea why?

What versions of Eclipse/ATF/XULRunner are you using?  How did you install?  Did you do anything before getting to this state?

Eclipse: 3.3.0 I20070625-1500    unzip
ATF: 0.2.3M3-v200708101615    archive install
XULRunner: 1.8.1.4-6.1                     rpm

The only thing that comes to mind is that I had a Mozilla browser tab open when I closed Eclipse down.
When I removed the tab and restarted Eclipse. the complaint went away.

> XULRunner: 1.8.1.4-6.1                     rpm

Does this contain the libjavaxpcom.so library?

> When I removed the tab and restarted Eclipse. the complaint went away.

So can you now successfully open a Mozilla browser tab?

It has javaxpcom.jar and libjavaxpcomglue.so.

I could always open a Mozilla browser tab. The problem occurs when Eclipse reopens the browser tab on startup.

I just noticed that bug 199923 might be related since that error also occurs when Eclipse starts up with a browser tab

traces.message: The function "removeWebBrowserListener" returned an error condition  (0x80004005)
